p: The virus underlying COVID-19 (SARS-CoV-2) is a betacoronavirus that is closely related to SARS-CoV. These CoVs share ~80% RNA sequence identity [ 30, 31]. The similarity is even greater between the viruses when comparing the sequences specific to a key drug target, the RNA-dependent RNA polymerase (RdRP) (>90% sequence identity) [ 30]. By contrast, MERS-CoV shares about 50% genomic sequence identity with SARS-CoV-2 [ 31], and with the exception of some bat strains, many animal CoVs are even less similar [ 12].
